intro: Gymnosporia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali gymnosporia, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and thorny stems. The plant produces woody, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds with a hard outer coat. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and can withstand periods of drought. Gymnosporia somalensis plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and may have traditional uses in local communities.
